name: Tokoferol
scoring: 3 g of seedlings were homogenized in 6 ml ethanol and extracted for 24 h at 25 °C.
growth_conditions: Plants were grown in a growth chamber in a long day (16 h light) photoperiod at 22 °C/18 °C  at day/night. The seeds were surface-sterilized by treatment with an aqueous solution of 5% calcium hypochlorite for 8 min, subsequently rinsed four times with sterile water and planted on plates. Before location in the growth chamber, plates with seeds were kept for 4 days at 4 °C in darkness for stratification. The Arabidopsis accessions were grown on Petri dishes on solid ½ Murashige-Skoog medium with vitamins and 0.8% agar. For each genotype analyzed plants were cultivated in at least three biological replicates. For the isolation of isoprenoids, entire 3-week-old seedlings were used.
to_definition: "The trait associated with an assay to determine the affected metabolite's profile." [GR:pj]
eo_definition: "The treatment involving study type in which plants were grown in growth chambers." [GR:pj]
uo_definition: "A mass unit which is equal to one millionth of a gram or 10^[-6] g." [UOC:GVG]

name: Sterol
scoring: 3 g of fresh seedlings, supplemented with internal standards were homogenized in 20 ml of chloroform/methanol solution (1/1, v/v) and extracted for 24 h at 25 °C.
growth_conditions:
Plants were grown in a growth chamber in a long day (16 h light) photoperiod at 22 °C/18 °C  at day/night. The seeds were surface-sterilized by treatment with an aqueous solution of 5% calcium hypochlorite for 8 min, subsequently rinsed four times with sterile water and planted on plates. Before location in the growth chamber, plates with seeds were kept for 4 days at 4 °C in darkness for stratification. The Arabidopsis accessions were grown on Petri dishes on solid ½ Murashige-Skoog medium with vitamins and 0.8% agar. For each genotype analyzed plants were cultivated in at least three biological replicates. For the isolation of isoprenoids, entire 3-week-old seedlings were used.
3 g of seedlings were homogenized in 6 ml ethanol and extracted for 24 h at 25 °C.
to_definition: "The trait associated with an assay to determine the affected metabolite's profile." [GR:pj]
eo_definition: "The treatment involving study type in which plants were grown in growth chambers." [GR:pj]
uo_definition: "A mass unit which is equal to one millionth of a gram or 10^[-6] g." [UOC:GVG]

name: Chlorophyll
scoring: 0.2 g of seedlings was homogenized in acetone, extracted for 24 h at 25 °C, centrifuged (2500 × g) and the supernatant was directly subjected to spectrophotometric analyses. All isolation steps were performed in darkness.
growth_conditions: Plants were grown in a growth chamber in a long day (16 h light) photoperiod at 22 °C/18 °C  at day/night. The seeds were surface-sterilized by treatment with an aqueous solution of 5% calcium hypochlorite for 8 min, subsequently rinsed four times with sterile water and planted on plates. Before location in the growth chamber, plates with seeds were kept for 4 days at 4 °C in darkness for stratification. The Arabidopsis accessions were grown on Petri dishes on solid ½ Murashige-Skoog medium with vitamins and 0.8% agar. For each genotype analyzed plants were cultivated in at least three biological replicates.

uo_definition: "A mass unit which is equal to one millionth of a gram or 10^[-6] g." [UOC:GVG]

name: Plastoquinone

0.5 g of seedlings was used. Isolation procedure was as described above, but
